import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column as it's not useful for modeling
train = train.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values: fill with median for numeric, mode for categorical
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill numeric with median, categorical with mode
train[numeric_columns] = train[numeric_columns].fillna(train[numeric_columns].median())
train[categorical_columns] = train[categorical_columns].fillna(train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
categorical_features = train[categorical_columns].columns.tolist()
X_train = train.drop([target], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop([target], axis=1)
y_train = train[target]
y_val = validation[target]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', encoder, categorical_features),
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Fit model
m

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train = train.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop([target], axis=1)
y_train = train[target]

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill missing values
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = categorical_columns.tolist()
X_val = validation.drop([target], axis=1)
y_val = validation[target]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore', sparse_output=False), categorical_features),
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Fit model

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train = train.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop([target], axis=1)
y_train = train[target]

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill missing values
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = categorical_columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore', sparse_output=False), categorical_features),
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
test_pred = model.predict(test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
print("Submis

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column from train and test
train = train.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop([target], axis=1)
y_train = train[target]

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill missing values
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = categorical_columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore', sparse_output=False), categorical_features),
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
test_pred = model.predict(test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
print("Submission saved to sub

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Extract Id from test data and remove it from features
test_Id = test['Id'].copy()
train = train.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop([target], axis=1)
y_train = train[target]

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill missing values
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = categorical_columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore', sparse_output=False), categorical_features),
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
test_pred = model.predict(test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_Id,
    'SalePrice': test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv',
